results.name: a(n) = c(1)p(1) + ... + c(n)p(n), where c(i) = 1 if a(i-1) <= p(i) and c(i) = -1 if a(i-1) > p(i), for i = 1,...,n (p(i) = primes).
comment: a(n) <= 2*prime(n). Conjecture: every number occurs in the sequence at most finitely many times. - _Thomas Ordowski_, Dec 03 2016
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
Index entries for sequences related to Recamán's sequence
program: f x (p:ps) | x' > 0    = x' : f x' ps
| otherwise = xp : f xp ps where x' = x - p; xp = x + p
